description: From mica +‎ -aceous. From Latin mīca (“grain, crumb”). Often erroneously associated with Latin micō (“to twinkle, glitter”) and hence with English micacious.

adjectives.description: micaceous (comparative more micaceous, superlative most micaceous)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, consisting of, containing or resembling mica.

examples: The book review was a micaceous example of perfection.
